Data module¶

Data functions¶

data.array(a, e=None, dtype=None)¶

Return a data.Data instance

Parameters:
  • a¶ – Estimation. Must be a data.Data instance or must be convertible to a numpy.ndarray.
  • e¶ – (Optional) Uncertainty. Must be convertible to a numpy.ndarray and must have the same shape as a (default None).
  • dtype¶ – (Optional) numpy dtype (default None)
data.isdata(a)¶

Check if object is an instance of Data or a numpy array of Data objects. Return True in both cases.

Parameters:a¶ – object
data.isnpdata(a)¶

Return True if object is a numpy array of Data objects.

Parameters:a¶ – object
data.erf(a)¶

Error function.

Uncertainty obtained via :math:`err = sigma_x

rac{d}{dx}erf(x)`

data.dawsn(a)¶

Dawson function

Uncertainty obtained via :math:`err = sigma_x

rac{d}{dx}daws(x)`

data.exp(a)¶

exponential of a Data array

data.sqrt(a)¶

exponential of a Data array

data.log10(a)¶

Log10 of a Data array

data.sum(a)¶

Sum of a Data array

data.nansum(a)¶

Nansum of a Data array

data.mean(a)¶

Mean of a Data array

data.nanmean(a)¶

Nanmean of a Data array

Data class¶

class data.Data(dat, err=None, dtype=None)¶

Bases: object

This class can be used as a substitute to a numpy.ndarray to store data.

Data can be stored with its error and general operations can be used to propagate the uncertainty with no effort, e.g.:

import orb.data as od
import numpy as np

x_dat = np.ones(5, dtype=float)
x_err = np.random.standard_normal(5)

a = od.array(x_dat, x_err)
b = od.array(x_dat, x_err)
c = a * b
print a
print od.mean(a)
print od.sum(od.log10(c))
print od.nanmean(a*b**2.)
__add__(b)¶

Implement self + b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__div__(b)¶

Implement self / b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__getitem__(key)¶

Implement self[key]

Parameters:key¶ – data slice.
Returns:a data.Data instance.
__iadd__(b)¶

Implement self += b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__idiv__(b)¶

Implement self /= b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__imul__(b)¶

Implement self *= b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__init__(dat, err=None, dtype=None)¶

Init of Data class.

Parameters:
  • dat¶ – Data map.
  • err¶ – Absolute error map. Must have the same shape as dat.

Implement self -= b

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.

Implement self * b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.
__neg__()¶

Implement - b.

__pos__()¶

Implement + b.

Implement self ** b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.

Implement self + b.

Parameters:b¶ – A numpy array or a Data instance. Must be broadcastable with self.

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_ascomplex()¶

Change data type to complex type

_check_data(m, err=False)¶

Check passed data

Parameters:
  • m¶ – data (a Data array)
  • err¶ – (Optional) True if data is an uncertainty (default False).

Getter for dat property.

Called by a = self.dat.

Called by a = self.err.

Called by self.dat = m.
